data.question: What is the main goal of substituting the central cobalt ion in vitamin B12 with other metals?
data.answer: The main goal is to explore the synthesis of transition-metal analogues of the natural cobalt-corrinoids.

data.question: What are the names of the Zn-analogues of cobyric acid and vitamin B12?
True or False: The solution structures of Znby and Znbl were studied using X-ray crystallography.
What method was used to study the solution structures of Znby and Znbl?
What was the yield percentage of Znby when prepared from Hby and ZnIIacetate?
True or False: Znby was found to be resistant to removal of the ZnII-ion in acidic aqueous solution.
What was the maximum emission wavelength of Znby in aqueous solution?
How was the covalent attachment of the B12-nucleotide moiety to Znby achieved?
data.answer: Using a recently developed carbodiimide method.

data.question: True or False: The absorption maxima of Znbl occurred at shorter wavelengths compared to Znby.
What was the fluorescence emission maximum of Znbl?
True or False: The structure of Znbl was established by X-ray crystallography.
What was the fluorescence lifetime of Znby at 296 K?
True or False: Znby sensitized the formation of 1O2 with a quantum yield of 0.70.
What was the energy of the lowest singlet excited state of Znby?
True or False: The phosphorescence of photo-excited Znby decayed with a lifetime of 13.1 msec at 77 K.
What was the first benchmark value for the lowest triplet state of a natural corrin ligand as observed in Znby?
True or False: The crystal structure of Znby indicated a minor increase in the radial size of the coordination hole on Zn-binding compared to Hby.
What was the major effect observed upon replacing the CoII-center in a vitamin B12 derivative with a ZnII-ion?
data.answer: A structural comparison of Znby and CoII-heptamethyl-cobyrinate perchlorate showed significant differences.

data.question: What computational method was used to shed further light on the structure of Znby?
True or False: The calculated structure of Znby closely reflected the observed crystallographic structural peculiarities.
